channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hurricanes Amplify Insurance Crisis in Riskiest Areas
item.description: After Helene and Milton, some small Florida companies risk bankruptcy. Larger ones will be in the hot seat with lawmakers and consumer groups.

item.title: Lebanon’s Leader Calls on U.N. for Cease-Fire as Beirut Searches for Airstrike Survivors
item.description: Rescuers dug through rubble in Beirut as the caretaker prime minister implored the United Nations to adopt a resolution calling for an “immediate” tru...

item.title: Trump’s new campaign pledge on autonomous EVs is good for Musk and Waymo, bad for China
item.description: Trump said on the campaign trail that he would ban Chinese-made autonomous vehicles if reelected to the White House this November.

item.title: Boris Johnson Makes a Case for Trump’s Return, and Perhaps, His Own
item.description: In his memoir, “Unleashed,” the former prime minister is “optimistic” about the possibility that Donald J. Trump could regain the White House.

item.title: In 2024 Election Countdown, Conservative Women Women Turn to a Biblical Queen
item.description: Alarmed by abortion and transgender rights, Christian activists are invoking the Old Testament story of Esther, the Jewish orphan who bravely saved he...

item.title: France’s president doesn’t want to lose ‘Emily in Paris’ to Rome—’We will fight hard’
item.description: Rome’s mayor shot back at Macron, telling him to focus on more pressing issues.

item.title: Israeli Strikes on Northern Gaza Kill at Least 20, Aid Workers Say
item.description: Israel’s military said it was “operating with great force” against Hamas and allied groups and issued new evacuation orders, as it also continued its ...

item.title: Daring Trump, Harris’s Campaign Says It Will Release Her Medical Information
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris’s campaign is trying to capitalize on a lack of health information shared by her rival. Candidates are often selective ab...

item.title: Canada Tightens Immigration Policy And Leaves Thousands in Limbo
item.description: Canada has long had one of the world’s most open immigration policies. Now, faced with a growing popular backlash, it’s changing the rules.

item.title: China Vows to Unleash More Borrowing to Spur Economy and Strengthen Banks
item.description: The finance minister said Beijing would sell bonds to supplement spending and help banks but did not detail how much.

item.title: The creator of ‘Moore’s Law’ said it couldn’t continue forever—and would be astounded by the chips Intel and its competitors are making now
item.description: The creator of Moore's Law acknowledged it couldn't 'continue forever'—but underestimated how human ingenuity keeps powering advances

item.title: Trump Leads in Arizona as Harris Holds an Edge in Pennsylvania, New Polls Show
item.description: The latest Times/Inquirer/Siena polls found Donald Trump with a six-point advantage in Arizona, and Kamala Harris with a four-point lead in Pennsylvan...

item.title: Good parenting boils down to just 4 strategies, according to experts
item.description: Here are some solid ways to lead with love while setting limits, according to experts.

item.title: Donald Trump is promising to bring back the America dream—but no one can agree on what it even is anymore
item.description: One thing's for sure: it's not about white picket fences anymore.
